title: How to Pack Your Bag for the Pool (Teen Girls)

steps.headline: Find a bag you think is cute.
steps.description: You need a medium to large sized tote bag. Find one that has loads of pockets, zips and compartments so you can pack everything you need.

steps.headline: Choose a bag with find a good design.
steps.description: The pattern and style should express your personality. Give your casual beach look that little pop with electric colors and funky patterns if you like. Bags are one-size-fits-all, you can use a bag that incorporates a pattern, style or colour that you might never consider in a garment.

steps.headline: Pack sunblock.
steps.description: The most important thing to pack is sunscreen. Even if you apply it before you get to the pool, you will need to reapply if you are at the pool for a long time.

steps.headline: Pack your sunglasses.
steps.description: You will need sunglasses, to protect yourself from the sun. Get big, wrap-around shades to protect your eyes from UVA and UVB rays If you like.

steps.headline: Prepare a first-aid kit, custom made for the pool.
steps.description:
Some main things you will need are:

Aloe Vera Gel. This is a must-have! Not only is it soothing to a bad case of sunburned skin, it promotes healing to the affected area too. This product is also made up of a light and non-greasy formula, which makes it much easier to apply. Petroleum Jelly. It's the miracle cure for anything chapped! Being in the sun can really dry out your skin and lips. Although cracked lips may not be fatal, they sure feel like it. Waterproof Plasters. Don't forget to pack the waterproof ones, so that they can keep bruises and cuts dry. Insect Repellent. If you've got sensitive skin, a small bite can end up being a big problem. This keeps mosquitoes, flies and other irritants away. Eye and Ear Drops. It can relieve irritation as well as prevent possible infections such as 'swimmers ears' which is a result of sea water, sand and debris.

steps.headline: Pack things important to you.
steps.description: After you pack these essentials, think about the things that are specific to you. Are you going to be tanning? Pack tanning oil. Do you happen to have your period? Take extra tampons. Should you be studying for a test or writing an essay? Take your study materials .

steps.headline: Pack items to entertain yourself with, because you might get bored.
steps.description: Things like your iPod, iPad, a book, magazines, or anything that you like will do. Always be careful of your belongings. Keep important things like your cellphone, iPod or mp3 player with you, or under your supervision,at all times.

steps.headline: Pack some food or money to buy food at the pool, because it is no fun to get out of the pool at lunchtime and have no money to satisfy your hunger.
Bring some snacks to nibble on.
steps.description:
The basic two are:
Food snacks like potato chips, energy bars, chocolate bars, etc. Drinks like Coke, Snapple, Sprite, A cold water bottle etc. Don't eat too much before you go to the pool because you don't want to throw up.

steps.headline: Pack an extra change of clothes for you to change when you know you're ready to get out of the water
Pack:
steps.description: A towel Deodorant A wide-toothed comb Cologne or Perfume, if you use them. Light makeup. Don't take too much-you don't want to look like a caked mannequin. A simple compact powder, lip balm and colorful eyeliner (who says you can't have fun with liner?) will do just fine.

steps.headline: If you are wearing your swimming costume to go to the pool, you don't need to pack it.
steps.description: If you aren't wearing it, pack it!. Once your bag is all packed, you are all ready to go!

text:
Getting a Bag Find a bag you think is cute. You need a medium to large sized tote bag. Find one that has loads of pockets, zips and compartments so you can pack everything you need. Choose a bag with find a good design. The pattern and style should express your personality. Give your casual beach look that little pop with electric colors and funky patterns if you like. Bags are one-size-fits-all, you can use a bag that incorporates a pattern, style or colour that you might never consider in a garment. Start packing your bag.  Remembering the Essentials Pack sunblock. The most important thing to pack is sunscreen. Even if you apply it before you get to the pool, you will need to reapply if you are at the pool for a long time. Pack your sunglasses. You will need sunglasses, to protect yourself from the sun. Get big, wrap-around shades to protect your eyes from UVA and UVB rays If you like. Prepare a first-aid kit, custom made for the pool. Some main things you will need are:

Aloe Vera Gel. This is a must-have! Not only is it soothing to a bad case of sunburned skin, it promotes healing to the affected area too. This product is also made up of a light and non-greasy formula, which makes it much easier to apply. Petroleum Jelly. It's the miracle cure for anything chapped! Being in the sun can really dry out your skin and lips. Although cracked lips may not be fatal, they sure feel like it. Waterproof Plasters. Don't forget to pack the waterproof ones, so that they can keep bruises and cuts dry. Insect Repellent. If you've got sensitive skin, a small bite can end up being a big problem. This keeps mosquitoes, flies and other irritants away. Eye and Ear Drops. It can relieve irritation as well as prevent possible infections such as 'swimmers ears' which is a result of sea water, sand and debris. Pack things important to you. After you pack these essentials, think about the things that are specific to you. Are you going to be tanning? Pack tanning oil. Do you happen to have your period? Take extra tampons. Should you be studying for a test or writing an essay? Take your study materials . Packing Fun Stuff & Entertainment Pack items to entertain yourself with, because you might get bored. Things like your iPod, iPad, a book, magazines, or anything that you like will do. Always be careful of your belongings. Keep important things like your cellphone, iPod or mp3 player with you, or under your supervision,at all times. Pack some food or money to buy food at the pool, because it is no fun to get out of the pool at lunchtime and have no money to satisfy your hunger.  Bring some snacks to nibble on. The basic two are:
Food snacks like potato chips, energy bars, chocolate bars, etc. Drinks like Coke, Snapple, Sprite, A cold water bottle etc. Don't eat too much before you go to the pool because you don't want to throw up. Grooming Pack an extra change of clothes for you to change when you know you're ready to get out of the water  Pack:  A towel Deodorant A wide-toothed comb Cologne or Perfume, if you use them. Light makeup. Don't take too much-you don't want to look like a caked mannequin. A simple compact powder, lip balm and colorful eyeliner (who says you can't have fun with liner?) will do just fine. Remember your flip-flops!  If you are wearing your swimming costume to go to the pool, you don't need to pack it. If you aren't wearing it, pack it!. Once your bag is all packed, you are all ready to go!
sentences: Getting a Bag Find a bag you think is cute.
You need a medium to large sized tote bag.
Find one that has loads of pockets, zips and compartments so you can pack everything you need.
Choose a bag with find a good design.
The pattern and style should express your personality.
Give your casual beach look that little pop with electric colors and funky patterns if you like.
Bags are one-size-fits-all, you can use a bag that incorporates a pattern, style or colour that you might never consider in a garment.
Start packing your bag.
Remembering the Essentials Pack sunblock.
The most important thing to pack is sunscreen.
Even if you apply it before you get to the pool, you will need to reapply if you are at the pool for a long time.
Pack your sunglasses.
You will need sunglasses, to protect yourself from the sun.
Get big, wrap-around shades to protect your eyes from UVA and UVB rays If you like.
Prepare a first-aid kit, custom made for the pool.

Some main things you will need are:

Aloe Vera Gel.
This is a must-have!
Not only is it soothing to a bad case of sunburned skin, it promotes healing to the affected area too.
This product is also made up of a light and non-greasy formula, which makes it much easier to apply.
Petroleum Jelly.
It's the miracle cure for anything chapped!
Being in the sun can really dry out your skin and lips.
Although cracked lips may not be fatal, they sure feel like it.
Waterproof Plasters.
Don't forget to pack the waterproof ones, so that they can keep bruises and cuts dry.
Insect Repellent.
If you've got sensitive skin, a small bite can end up being a big problem.
This keeps mosquitoes, flies and other irritants away.
Eye and Ear Drops.
It can relieve irritation as well as prevent possible infections such as 'swimmers ears' which is a result of sea water, sand and debris.
Pack things important to you.
After you pack these essentials, think about the things that are specific to you.
Are you going to be tanning?
Pack tanning oil.
Do you happen to have your period?
Take extra tampons.
Should you be studying for a test or writing an essay?
Take your study materials .
Packing Fun Stuff & Entertainment Pack items to entertain yourself with, because you might get bored.
Things like your iPod, iPad, a book, magazines, or anything that you like will do.
Always be careful of your belongings.
Keep important things like your cellphone, iPod or mp3 player with you, or under your supervision,at all times.
Pack some food or money to buy food at the pool, because it is no fun to get out of the pool at lunchtime and have no money to satisfy your hunger.
Bring some snacks to nibble on.

The basic two are:
Food snacks like potato chips, energy bars, chocolate bars, etc.
Drinks like Coke, Snapple, Sprite, A cold water bottle etc.
Don't eat too much before you go to the pool because you don't want to throw up.
Grooming Pack an extra change of clothes for you to change when you know you're ready to get out of the water  Pack:  A towel Deodorant A wide-toothed comb Cologne or Perfume, if you use them.
Light makeup.
Don't take too much-you don't want to look like a caked mannequin.
A simple compact powder, lip balm and colorful eyeliner (who says you can't have fun with liner?)
will do just fine.
Remember your flip-flops!
If you are wearing your swimming costume to go to the pool, you don't need to pack it.
If you aren't wearing it, pack it!.
Once your bag is all packed, you are all ready to go!
